title: Air taxi manufacturer Joby Aviation ups flight tests with onboard pilots
summary: Joby CEO JoeBen Bevirt said government support on the state and federal level will help the U.S. to lead the technology for electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft.

title: DOT awards $3.2B to 180 projects
summary: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said the Biden administration left the transportation department with 3,200 unobligated grants.

title: Uber expands robotaxis in partnership with Waymo, May Mobility, others
summary: Atlanta will soon join Austin, Texas, offering autonomous Uber ride-hailing vehicles, the company's CEO, Dara Khosrowshahi, said today.

title: Amtrak could modernize Northeast Corridor for less: NYU study
summary: Researchers at New York University propose innovations to turn the Northeast Corridor into a true high-speed rail line, benefiting commuters and intercity riders.

title: California DMV proposes new AV regulation framework
summary: Heavy-duty autonomous vehicles over 10,001 pounds can be tested with a DMV-approved permit under the state’s new framework.

summary: If enacted, some 78 projects funded by the Neighborhood Access and Equity program would be at risk of losing grants previously awarded.

summary: The contractors expect to wrap up work on Massachusetts’ first diverging diamond interchange by mid-2030.

summary: Los Angeles becomes the sixth city where Zoox is testing its autonomous vehicles. The company expects to accept customers this year in Las Vegas.

title: EPA to end environmental justice programs, monitoring tools
summary: As part of the Trump administration’s end to environmental justice programs, it has cut off access to EJScreen, a monitoring tool used to track environmental justice metrics.

title: EPA revisiting dozens of climate, environment rules in ‘day of deregulation’
summary: The agency said it would roll back a range of rules and programs, including some that are foundational to its efforts to address climate change. A new WOTUS definition is expected, as well as rollbacks to an emissions reporting program.

title: DOT removes equity, environmental factors from IIJA funding decisions
summary: The move rolls back a Biden-era policy that included these considerations in decision-making criteria for infrastructure projects.
